revised_title: The Production of Neon and Helium by the Electrical Discharge: Further Experiments and Observations
tldr: The authors investigate the production of neon and helium through electrical discharges and examine various experimental setups and electrode materials. They find that the nature of the break and the type of electrode material can influence the results, and that the minimum detectable quantity of neon is comparable to that in a few cubic millimeters of atmospheric air.
